summary: This Bash script runs Firefox within a sandboxed environment (firejail) and pipes its output to a Python tracker script. It seems to be used for GUI-based operations on Linux x86_64 systems.

details.comment: This Bash script runs Firefox within a sandboxed environment (firejail) and pipes its output to a Python tracker script. It seems to be used for GUI-based operations on Linux x86_64 systems.
details.content:
#!/bin/bash
#mkfifo blitx
# maybe we need to use some nonblocking reading.
#firejail firefox &> /dev/null & echo $!
firejail firefox &>/dev/stdout | python3 tracker_gui_linux_x86_64.py
